importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott was reported missing on this date, and the black Hyundai Accent was reported stolen the same day, which became central to the investigation.
The remains of Kada Scott were discovered on this date, marking a significant development in the case.
The stolen vehicle was seen on video near Scott’s disappearance and later found on fire, linking it to King’s actions.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe of Scott's disappearance and the subsequent theft and burning of a vehicle on that day ties multiple events together, including King's alleged involvement.

keyTakeAways: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman reported missing for about two weeks, were found behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia.
An anonymous tip led investigators to re-examine a previously searched site, resulting in the discovery of her remains in a shallow grave, confirmed by DNA testing.
Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, causing or risking a catastrophe, conspiracy, and possibly homicide.
King’s cellphone was located in areas related to Scott’s disappearance, and video evidence shows his vehicle being parked near the site where Scott was later found.
The black Hyundai Accent was reported stolen a day before Scott went missing and was seen at a recreation center on the night of October 4; it later burned at a junkyard.
Prosecutors say King and Scott had cell phone contact, and that further charges are under consideration, including homicide, due to suspicious circumstances and evidence.
Additional charges related to the vehicle fire were filed, and authorities believe others may have been involved after the fact, though that remains under investigation.
King previously faced kidnapping charges in another case, which were dropped due to non-appearance of the victim and witness, but he was arrested earlier this year and released on $200,000 bail.
Kada Scott was remembered by her parents as a person of light, kindness, and beautiful spirit, and they expressed deep grief over her disappearance and death.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of 23-year-old missing woman Kada Scott were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia, confirmed through DNA testing. The discovery was prompted by a more specific anonymous tip that led investigators to re-examine a previously searched location. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and possibly homicide, with evidence showing his cellphone activity and vehicle sightings linked to the timeline of Scott’s disappearance. A black Hyundai Accent, reported stolen the day before Scott went missing, was seen in a recreation center and later found on fire, adding to the circumstantial evidence. While King was previously released on $200,000 bail after charges were dropped in another case, this new investigation suggests deeper criminal involvement. Prosecutors say more charges are being pursued, and they believe others may have been involved after the fact. Scott’s parents have expressed deep sorrow, calling her a source of light and kindness.
title: Remains Found Behind Abandoned School Belong to Missing Philadelphia Woman, Kada Scott
